description: China has been blocking fishermen from a reef near the Philippines for four years, in another flash point in the dispute over the South China Sea.
title: Our Boat Was Intercepted by China
title_page: Our Boat Was Intercepted by China - The New York Times
maintext:
Narrated by Javier C. Hernández, a New York Times correspondent based in Beijing. Mr. Hernández and Sergey Ponomarev, a photographer, attempted to visit Scarborough Shoal in late June. The tribunal in The Hague ruled on Tuesday, July 12, that China's claims are illegal. But it has no power to enforce the decision.
More stories about the dispute for the South China Sea
Produced by Sergio Peçanha, Josh Williams and David Furst
Satellite photographs by CSIS Asia Maritime Transparency Initiative / DigitalGlobe. Photographs by Sergey Ponomarev, videos by Mr. Ponomarev and Javier C. Hernández.
